required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Effectiveness and Operability of Using the New Tissue Containment System During Laparoscopic Ovarian Cystectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Effectiveness and Operability of Using the New Tissue Containment System With Hard Pipes Which Can Assemble With Detachable Trocars Seamlessly for Tissue Removal During Laparoscopic Ovarian Cystectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to evaluate the safety, effectiveness and operability of performing in-bag cystectomy and morcellation with the new tissue containment system during laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy. Premenopausal women, aged 18-45 undergoing laparoscopic cystectomy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of study - approximately two years
primary_outcome.description: • Exposure is defined as "disruption of the device (using dye leak testing or water testing) or visible tissue dissemination".

secondary_outcome.description: The ovarian reserve function is reflected by the concentration of anti-mullerian hormone(AMH)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within one week after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Mean procedure time will be measured by hour/minutes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within one week after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Blood loss during operation will be measured by volume (mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Intra- or post-operative complications
secondary_outcome.description: Intra or post complications rate (e.g. urinary, intestinal or nerve injury)

secondary_outcome.measure: The patients' life quality postoperative: questionaire
secondary_outcome.description: The patients' life quality will be measured by The World Health Organization's Quality of Life Questionnaire-Brief Version（WHOQOL-BREF).The maximum value is 120 and the minimum is 0. The higher score means a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within one week after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The Surgery Task Load Index will be measured by questionaire. The maximum value is 120 and the minimum is 0. The higher score means a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of failure during in-bag cystectomy procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study - approximately two years
secondary_outcome.description: Failure is defined as the operator's inability to successfully insert and extract the device.

arm_group.arm_group_label: the New Tissue Containment System group
arm_group.description: Using the New Tissue Containment System during Laparoscopic Ovarian Cystectomy
Without any protection system during Laparoscopic Ovarian Cystectomy

intervention.description: Laparoscopic Ovarian Cystectomy using the New Tissue Containment System
intervention.arm_group_label: the New Tissue Containment System group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Premenopausal woman patient age 18-45 years
- Women with regular period
- Women with ovarian neoplasm (size: 3-10cm)
- Laparoscopic surgery required
- Body mass index 18.5-27.9kg/m2
- Subject able to comprehend and give informed consent for participation in this study
- Signed informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is not considered suitable for a laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy procedure
- The ovaries and pelvic cavity are severely adhered, and the tumor ruptures when free
- Women with Polycystic ovary syndrome
- Baseline AMH less than 0.5ng / mL
- Known to have participated in any other clinical trials or hormone therapy within 3 months
- Women during pregnancy and lactation
- Women in acute stage infection of reproductive system or other parts
- Women combined with severe central nervous system, cardiovascular system, liver and kidney, digestive tract, respiratory system, endocrine metabolism (thyroid disease, Cushing syndrome, hyperprolactinemia) and skeletal muscle system and mental disorders contraindicating laparoscopic surgery
- Women with known or suspected poor compliance who cannot complete the trial
- Those who can not sign the informed consent

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice Director of Obstetrics and Gynecology
